replies.bodyText: I like the explicitness of getConditionsForEncounter().
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: We need to assert that the conditions that are returned are actually those that are expected. Use two conditions as well to enforce the use of an actual "collection".
timeline.author: mks-d

replies.bodyText:
Always use the given/when/then pattern when writing tests. This makes easier for the reader to find what you actually replay.
Unless @dkayiwa thinks differently?

replies.bodyText: I like conventions that make code easier to understand. 👍

timeline.bodyText: I would not silently ignore one passing a null parameter. In other words, i would remove the if check and assume that the condition is not null. If it turns out to be null, better for the caller to automatically get a NullPointerException than chewing it quietly.
timeline.author: dkayiwa
samuelmale

replies.bodyText: I feel that the existing behaviour is not a good one to copy. How can one add a null object and the api just silently ignore it?
replies.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: I agree with you here. The API shouldn't have back doors. Nice catch!
replies.author: samuelmale
